121a213d-4c11-4614-8abb-3ed27ca9acf1.name: Panko Encrusted Lime Chicken
ingredients: 2 Large chicken breast, skinned and de-boned
2 Limes, Juice both, and zest one and set aside
3 cups Frying Oil, Can be veg oil, canola, or peanut.
instructions: Cut chicken into large chunks, then place in large bowl. Add the zest of one lime, salt and peper. Cover and let marinate for at least 15 mins in refrigerator. While the chicken is chilling, set a large pot/skillet on meduim high heat with 2-3 cups of oil for frying.

In 3 bowls/pans add the flour to one, the eggs(wisked) to the other , and the last add the panko bread crumbs. Dredge the chicken chunks into the flour then, egg mixture, and lastly in to the panko set aside. Repete til all of the chicken is battered.
Slowly add the chicken to the hot oil, and fry until golden brown. Set on rack or paper towl to drain.
In a large bowl add the fryed chicken and toss with hosin, and lime juice.

4e895d22-557c-497d-b1ae-31d200c1a7f1.name: Thai Basil Chicken
ingredients: 3 Thai Bird Chilies, (Red Thai Chili Peppers)
1/2 Red Onion, Chopped long, not diced
1 pound Ground Chicken, Can Substitue with Turkey
1 cup White Steamed Rice, (if served over rice) optional
1/2 Head of Lettuce, (if served as wraps)
instructions: In a wok (or large pan) over high heat, add oil, chilies, red onions, and garlic and fry for 1-2 minutes
Add ground chicken or turkey and stir fry for 2 more minutes, breaking meat up into small bits
Add fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar or honey, stir fry for another minute
Add chicken broth and stir to deglaze pan. Broth should cook off fairly quicky over high heat.
After broth cooks off, add Thai Basil leaves and cook until wilted
Remove from heat and serve over steamed white rice or in lettuce wraps

e95cee2a-33f5-40af-bb50-a98cccb57926.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 2 cups Chocolate Chips (I use a mixture of dark chocolate and milk chocolate)
1 cup Nuts (I use a mixture of walnuts and pecans)
1/2 teaspoon Cream of tartar (for cookie texture)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix together butter and sugar until smooth.
Beat eggs into mixture (one at a time).
Add vanilla.
Dissolve the baking soda into the hot water then add to the mixture.
Add cream of tartar (if desired) for texture ... not necessary for flavor.
Add and flour into mixture.
Add chips and nuts.
Drop by large spoonfuls onto ungreased pans.
Bake for 10 minutes.
